betterquesting:10.desc:8:
You've long known that Thaumium is able to repair itself using Vis from your wand if it has the right enchantments, and that Essentia is able to transmute into solid material when given a sample to follow (albeit not in a useful capacity in most cases).

Combining those thoughts, could you create a Thaumium something or another that is able to take a damaged item as a "sample", and transmute Essentia into whatever is needed to repair that damage?

After a fair bit of work that is exactly what you've created. The Thaumic Restorer will use Instrumentum Essentia to repair most (read: Non-TiC or GT) tools. It's also able to repair a few non-tool items. To check if something can be repaired simply try to place it in the Restorer. If it can't, it can't.

Â§3Ignore the Thaumic Restorer saying it needs Perditio when looking at it with Goggles of Revealing. It most definitely uses Instrumentum, and only that.
